speaker: Skyline
text: A silver dirigible floats above the skyline. [_N.B. This episode was originally scheduled to air February 3rd, and then March 23rd._] _ACT ONE  Scene One -- Cafe Nervosa Niles and Daphne are sitting in the window box.  Daphne gives an order to the waitress. _

speaker: Daphne
text: And one of those cinnamon buns, please -- extra frosting. _Brad and Cindy, another expecting couple, enter.  Cindy's bump is very prominent._

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, here they are.

speaker: Cindy
text: We were so excited when you guys asked us out.  You're like the A-list couple in Lamaze class.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh well, that's good to hear.  We were afraid we were in the "C-section." _Daphne laughs (apparently she's lived under his roof long enough to find that funny).  Brad unpacks some plastic containers and a thermos filled with a green- colored smoothie._

speaker: Brad
text: We bring our own food everywhere.  Cindy doesn't put anything unhealthy in her body.  No refined sugar, white flour or gluten.  I'm sure you're the same.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, of course.

speaker: Waitress
text: Cinnamon bun.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, no thank you, I'm pregnant.

speaker: Waitress
text: But you said-

speaker: Daphne
text: I said no!

speaker: Cindy
text: Sweetie, this is your best yam loaf yet. [_to Niles and Daphne_] He's a saint.  He cooks my food, rubs cocoa butter on my belly...

speaker: Brad
text: I just wish I could go through the birth for her.

speaker: Brad
text: Hey, what are you guys doing with your placenta?

speaker: Cindy
text: Ours will nourish the roots of a special tree we plant in our yard.

speaker: Brad
text: Well, we live in an apartment.  Although that ficus in the study is looking a tad droopy.

speaker: Cindy
text: By the way, if you need a doula-

speaker: Brad
text: Cindy, I'm sure they already have one.  Everybody has a doula. Ours is a treasure.  She'll be there through the whole delivery. Focusing our energies, giving us emotional support -- I don't know how people do it without one.

speaker: Cindy
text: She's really helped Brad.  He's having a really tough sympathy pregnancy.

speaker: Brad
text: [_rubs his stomach_] Oh, boy.

speaker: Cindy
text: Honey?

speaker: Brad
text: I'm just... I'm feeling a little sick again, I'm sorry. I just need some air.

speaker: Cindy
text: We're so in sync.  He feels everything I'm feeling: nausea, weight gain, food cravings.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, you know, in psychological terms, that's called Couvade Syndrome.

speaker: Cindy
text: [_shrugs_] We just call it love.

speaker: Niles
text: I don't like them.

speaker: Daphne
text: They're getting so much more out of this than we are. We don't even have a placenta plan!

speaker: Niles
text: No, wait -- let's not panic.  All we need is expert help. We'll hire one of those doula people.  I'll get the number from Brad.

speaker: Brad
text: Sorry, sorry.  Oh, this pregnancy is taking it out of me. [_rubs his nipples_] Oh, my breasts are so tender today.

speaker: Niles
text: [_jumps on the bandwagon_] You know what?  I'm starting to feel a bit nauseous. _FADE OUT  Scene Two -- Frasier's Office Building The elevator doors part to reveal Frasier, with his nose buried in a newspaper, and another man.  Both get off the elevator.  The man continues down the hall, while Frasier walks down a few steps and, with his eyes still on the paper, inserts his key into his office door.  Only the key doesn't fit.  Just as he looks up and realizes it is the wrong door, it is pulled open by a smiling woman, Charlotte. _ [_N.B. Laura Linney also voiced the guest caller Mindy in[[10.17]](/frasier/transcripts/season_10/episode_17/kenny_on_the_couch.html "Kenny On The Couch"), "Kenny on the Couch."_]

speaker: Charlotte
text: Hi!  Welcome to Charlotte's Web: a matchmaking service. Come in!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I'm-I'm sorry, isn't this...?  Oh, I see what happened.  I must have been so engrossed in my paper I went right past my floor.

speaker: Charlotte
text: Of course.  It can be a little embarrassing to admit you need help in the romance department, please come in.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, this was a mistake.

speaker: Charlotte
text: I understand. [_more insistent_] Come in.

speaker: Frasier
text: Trust me, you are comically incorrect.  I do not need a matchmaker.

speaker: Charlotte
text: So you're married?

speaker: Frasier
text: No.

speaker: Charlotte
text: Dating someone?

speaker: Frasier
text: I date plenty.  In fact, I often need the proverbial stick one uses to beat women off... with.  I... [_rallies_] I believe my point is made. [_turns back to the elevator_]

speaker: Charlotte
text: [_holds out a_] Why don't you just take my card?

speaker: Frasier
text: I don't need your card.

speaker: Charlotte
text: In case you change your mind.

speaker: Frasier
text: I won't change my mind.

speaker: Charlotte
text: For a friend.

speaker: Frasier
text: I have no friends. [_realizes_] ...who are in need of your services.  You see, I am a bit of a local celebrity, so I have no trouble getting dates. [_calls the elevator_]

speaker: Charlotte
text: Really?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.

speaker: Charlotte
text: What's your name?

speaker: Frasier
text: Dr. Frasier Crane.

speaker: Charlotte
text: Oh! [_then_] Sorry, doesn't ring any bells. _The elevator arrives.  Several passengers exit, leaving an attractive young woman (Ellie).  Frasier steps on with her._

speaker: Ellie
text: Frasier Crane?

speaker: Frasier
text: Why, yes it is.

speaker: Ellie
text: Well, my God, what are you doing here?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, actually, I have an office one floor down.

speaker: Ellie
text: Really?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.

speaker: Ellie
text: I'm on 18.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh well, why don't I ride up with you?  I could use the exercise.

speaker: Frasier
text: Bye-bye. _The doors close.  Reset to: Inside Elevator_

speaker: Ellie
text: It's so funny seeing you here.

speaker: Frasier
text: It's funny for you, delightful for me.  It's always nice to meet a fan, especially one so attractive.

speaker: Ellie
text: You don't remember me?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, of course I remember you!  It's you.  Hey, you.

speaker: Ellie
text: I can't believe you don't remember.  We dated -- three times!

speaker: Frasier
text: ...Jennifer.

speaker: Ellie
text: Ellie.

speaker: Frasier
text: Ellie! [_elevator stops_] Oh well, here's your floor.  Nice catching up with you.

speaker: Ellie
text: Oh, brushing me off - that sounds familiar. _Reset to: Hallway Charlotte is waiting for the elevator.  The doors open on a scene completely different from the one they closed on._

speaker: Ellie
text: Oh, not that I'm surprised you forgot me.  You spent every day talking about yourself, and then, after we slept together...

speaker: Frasier
text: [_stumbling out_] I'm so sorry.  Sorry...

speaker: Ellie
text: But you could've CALLED me!

speaker: Frasier
text: Sorry!  Again, so sorry. _The doors close.  Frasier stands there, facing the elevator.  Charlotte has kept her mouth shut and her eyes down.  They stand in silence for a moment, then as one they turn back into the hallway, and he follows her into her office.  FADE TO:_ **MATCH GAME** _Scene Three -- Office Frasier is pacing the office and telling Charlotte his history. _

speaker: Frasier
text: And so it seems I have dated every woman in Seattle!  The well is dry.  The cupboard is bare.  There are no more fish in the sea.  Meanwhile my dad is engaged, my brother is expecting his first child, while I am left to spin aimlessly on the dating hamster wheel.

speaker: Charlotte
text: You like your metaphors, don't you?  Well, don't worry, Frasier.  Somewhere in Seattle there's a woman you haven't pissed off, and I'm gonna find her.

speaker: Frasier
text: You seem awfully sure of yourself.

speaker: Charlotte
text: I am.  I've successfully matched hundreds of couples.  So...

speaker: Charlotte
text: What kind of woman are you looking for?  And don't just say smart, sexy, and sophisticated.

speaker: Frasier
text: Why, don't you have any of those?

speaker: Frasier
text: All right.  Well, it's hard to say what I want.  It's been so long since I've really fallen for someone.  You know that feeling you get after a first date, when you can't even sleep? You just lie there in bed awake, thinking about her.  That's what I want.

speaker: Charlotte
text: You're going to make me work for my money, aren't you? Uh, by the way, I do require a payment up-front.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, of course.

speaker: Charlotte
text: My fee's $10,000.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_after a beat_] That's awfully steep.

speaker: Charlotte
text: And those ten years of bad dates, how much did they run you?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_after another beat_] I'll write you a check. _FADE TO:  Scene Four -- Cafe Nervosa Frasier is having coffee with Roz. _

speaker: Frasier
text: So I gave her the money and I filled out the questionnaire.

speaker: Roz
text: Hm.  You fudged a little bit on your answers, right?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, of course not.  Why would I?

speaker: Roz
text: Because nobody's honest on those things.  There's a code people use.  Like "mature" means old, "athletic" means flat- chested, and, uh... oh, "not model thin" means circus fat.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, gosh.  She's already sent me out on a date this evening. But I assure you, I am more interested in personality than looks.

speaker: Roz
text: Did you see a photo at least?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, of course I saw a photo.  She's got a personality you can bounce a quarter off of.

speaker: Roz
text: So where you taking her?

speaker: Frasier
text: Claret - I intend to take all subsequent dates there as well. That way I can compare them objectively, you see.  As the woman will be the only variable.  It's basic science!

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah, that's been your dating problem -- not enough science.

speaker: Daphne
text: Hey, you two! _They ad-lib greetings.  Frasier gives up his seat to Daphne, and takes another as she and Niles sit._

speaker: Niles
text: We can only chat for a moment.  We're meeting our doula.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, yes.  Your doula.

speaker: Roz
text: Anybody need anything?  I'm getting more coffee.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, no thanks, we brought fennel tea and some healthy snacks to nibble on.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, peanut butter and carrots.  Looks like somebody has pregnancy cravings.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, I just can't help myself. [_reaches for some_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh dear, Niles -- Couvade Syndrome?

speaker: Niles
text: We just call it love.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well... I have a date.  I've signed up with a matchmaking service.

speaker: Niles
text: Wait, Frasier, a matchmaker?  I'm surprised you'd use a professional for something as personal as your love life.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I could say the same thing about you and your doula.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, our professional comes highly recommended.

speaker: Frasier
text: So does mine.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, our professional is at the top of her field.

speaker: Frasier
text: As is mine.

speaker: Niles
text: [_while Daphne looks weary_] Well, our professional charges $200 an hour.

speaker: Frasier
text: Mine charges 10,000!

speaker: Niles
text: [_taken aback_] She sounds fantastic!  Congratulations, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you, Niles.  Wish me luck!

speaker: Niles
text: Good luck. [_still impressed_] Wow. _Frasier exits, passing a fey woman wrapped in an afghan with her arms hugging her body._

speaker: Harvest
text: [_ethereal voice_] Daphne and Niles?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, you must be Harvest.

speaker: Daphne
text: So nice to meet you. [_Roz comes back_] Oh, this is our friend Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: Hi.

speaker: Harvest
text: [_hands to Niles_] A resume detailing my 15 years of experience, plus a syllabus for further reading.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I am "doula impressed."

speaker: Harvest
text: Now, on page five you'll find details about my support staff. There's a masseuse, a shaman of course, and a drummer.  He used to tour with the Doobie Brothers.  Very talented.

speaker: Niles
text: My, sounds expensive.  I can't wait to tell Frasier.

speaker: Harvest
text: And of course I insist on a drug-free birthing environment-

speaker: Roz
text: Whoa, back up.  No drugs?

speaker: Harvest
text: Oh, I want Daphne to be awake and connected to the moment. A natural childbirth needn't be painful.

speaker: Roz
text: It needn't be, but it be.

speaker: Daphne
text: How painful?

speaker: Roz
text: Would you have a tooth pulled without Novocaine?

speaker: Daphne
text: [_afraid_] No.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, a tooth is this big. [_measures with her fingers_]

speaker: Harvest
text: Oh, I'm sorry.  I thought you wanted to be emotionally present for the birth of your baby. [_rises and takes back her papers_] But I see that you just want somebody to dope you up, strap you down, and yank it out.

speaker: Niles
text: [_rises_] Oh, no, no, wait, wait, wait, don't go.

speaker: Daphne
text: Yes, our friend was just leaving. [_glares at Roz_]

speaker: Roz
text: All right. [_gets up_] You're right, I'm sorry.  This is a private matter. [_strokes Daphne's head supportively_] You need to do what's right for you. _Daphne nods, smiling -- and Roz yanks a hair out of her head. _

speaker: Daphne
text: Ow!

speaker: Roz
text: Times a million. _Roz walks out, as Niles rubs his temples and Daphne worriedly puts a hand to her head.  FADE TO:_ **DATING GAME** _Scene Five -- Claret Frasier pulls out the chair for his date, an attractive blond. _

speaker: Frasier
text: Here we are.

speaker: Date 1
text: Thank you.

speaker: Frasier
text: There's something wonderful about first dates, isn't there? [_the waiter hands them their menus_] Oh, thank you very much. That tingle of anticipation as two perfect strangers march toward endless vistas of possibility.

speaker: Date 1
text: Well put, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh well, thank you.  [_N.B. Throughout the following scene(s), the camera angle switches between Frasier's side of the table and his date's._]

speaker: Frasier
text: And what do you do?

speaker: Date 1
text: I'm a science teacher.

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah, serendipity.  I'm a science man myself.  I suppose that's why Charlotte got the two of us together.  Well then, what's your field?

speaker: Date 1
text: Well, my field is biology, but my specialty is creationism.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh well, I find that... excuse me?

speaker: Date 1
text: You know, they're only in first grade, so they don't understand everything.  But Brother William, he's our leader, he likes us to get them started young before they get their minds warped by all that fossil nonsense.  [_N.B. For the benefit of readers in Canada or Europe, where this debate is probably not as lively, or even extant: creationism is the belief that takes the Book of Genesis literally, that the earth and humanity were created by God in seven days, and that the earth is only as old as human history - a few tens of thousands of years.  The theory deliberately rebutted Charles Darwin's theories that the earth is several hundred million years old, and that all species, including man, gradually evolved from lesser ones.  Particularly offensive to creationists is Darwin's theory that humans are descended from apes.  This debate was particularly heated in the American South, where several states passed laws prohibiting the teaching of Darwin's theories in elementary schools -- which led to the highly public "Scopes Monkey Trial" in the 1930's, upon which the play "Inherit the Wind" was based.  See also Frasier's reference to it in [[2.13]](/frasier/transcripts/season_2/episode_13/retirement_is_murder.html "Retirement Is Murder"), "Retirement is Murder."_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, you know, I-I realize that Darwin had his detractors, but to call it nonsense seems a bit cavalier, don't you think?

speaker: Date 1
text: [_leans back_] Oh, dear.  You're one of those. [_Frasier looks confused_] You think we're descended from apes?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, not recently, no.

speaker: Date 1
text: Do I look like an ape to you?  Do I have hairy palms and a big hairy back?

speaker: Frasier
text: Would you like a drink? _SWITCH: the woman on the other side of the table is now Frasier's second date -- a short brunette woman with a voice and manner as coarse as burlap. _

speaker: Date 2
text: Oh yeah, bring it on.  But I got to warn you -- I'm a horny drunk.  Last Spring in Cabo, I wake up one morning under a beach umbrella, stark naked, tequila bottle in one hand, and some guy's tightie-whities on my head!  [_N.B. She makes Sherry Dempsey from Seasons 4 and 5 look like a Victorian headmistress._] _Frasier's smile is frozen on his face.  The waiter happens by with a long pepper mill._

speaker: Date 2
text: [_to the mill_] Whoa!  Don't I know you from Cabo? [_braying laugh_] Remind you of anything? [_laugh_] You wish, right? [_laugh_]

speaker: Frasier
text: That's, uh, very amusing.  So what do you do for a living? [_N.B. Though Frasier's lines function both as responses to his last date and prompts for his next one, he's wearing a different suit in each take, also indicating the change._]

speaker: Date 3
text: Well, right now I'm back in school.  You see, I've loved animals my whole life... _She reaches up and scratches her head, causing her hair to shift back and forth and reveal a bed of stubble underneath -- it's a wig. _

speaker: Date 3
text: So I figured, why not really go for it, you know?  So I'm going to become a taxidermist.

speaker: Date 3
text: Is something wrong?

speaker: Frasier
text: No.  I was just, uh, admiring your ensemble. _SWITCH: Date #4 A heavyset woman with pigtails, dressed in a hideous, psychedelic patchwork tunic stitched from old plaid quilts._

speaker: Date 4
text: Thanks.  I made it myself.  You know, I have a lot of this fabric left.  I could make you a shirt with a matching hat.

speaker: Frasier
text: Don't go to any trouble.  Would you like some wine? _SWITCH: Date #5 A teenager in a denim jacket, slouched back in her chair and chewing gum._

speaker: Date 5
text: Nah, the cops took my fake I.D., and my dad'll kill me if I get busted again.  So what are you, like fifty?

speaker: Frasier
text: Something like that.  [_N.B. An interesting hedge here - Frasier's birth year is given as 1952, so he'd be fifty-two now.  Kelsey Grammer, on the other hand, is only forty-nine._] _END OF ACT ONE  ACT TWO  Scene Six -- Frasier's Apartment Niles and Daphne are seated on the couch.  Niles is snacking on something.  Martin is reading the paper in his Armchair.  Frasier comes out and gets his coat. _

speaker: Frasier
text: [_taut singsong_] Well, I'm off.

speaker: Daphne
text: No, you can't.  Our doula is coming specifically to meet you and your father.

speaker: Niles
text: She insists on knowing all the members of the baby's energy circle.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, what kind of a kook is she anyway?

speaker: Niles
text: Harvest is not a kook. [_starts rubbing his nipples_] She's assisted at the birth of more than 600 babies -- and two giant pandas.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, she better get here quickly -- I do have a date.

speaker: Niles
text: Another one?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yeah.

speaker: Niles
text: You're doing fairly well by this matchmaker.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, hardly. [_drops his coat_] A monkey throwing darts at the Seattle phone book would find me a better mate.  Hell, a dart- throwing monkey would be a better mate.

speaker: Martin
text: Why don't you fire her?

speaker: Frasier
text: Don't think I haven't considered it.  If tonight's a bust, I'm going to demand my money back. _Niles rises awkwardly, and walks to the dining table.  He has obviously gained weight, and his bulging stomach has turned his normal arrow- straight walk into something unrecognizable._

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, have you gained weight?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, but you know, you always put on a lot with your first baby. The hardest part is the mood swings. _He gets a large piece of something from the table and takes a bite. The others just look at Daphne, who shrugs helplessly._

speaker: Martin
text: Geez Niles, don't you think you're taking this sympathetic pregnancy thing too far?

speaker: Niles
text: I'm simply giving in to the primal cycle of... [_sinks down onto the couch gratefully_] life.  I have no control over it.

speaker: Frasier
text: In that case, get off my Chanel couch before your water breaks.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, hello.  I'm Dr. Frasier Crane.

speaker: Harvest
text: Harvest Finkleman, delighted. [_raises her hand, but does not shake his_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh.  Well, I'm sorry, I can't stay.  Niles and Daphne you know of course, and this is my dad.  Martin Crane, Ms. Finkleman- Delighted.

speaker: Harvest
text: Nice to meet you, Martin.

speaker: Martin
text: Likewise.

speaker: Harvest
text: So are you planning to participate in your grandchild's birth?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh no, I'm kind of old school.  Clean the kid up, slap a bow on her head, then call me in.

speaker: Harvest
text: Oh!  Guess who had their baby -- Brad and Cindy?

speaker: Niles
text: [_overcome, high-pitched with crying_] Oh, I'm so happy for them!

speaker: Daphne
text: He gets very emotional lately.

speaker: Harvest
text: It was a beautiful experience.  I made a tape if you'd like to see it.

speaker: Martin
text: [_lifting his paper_] I would like to NOT see it.

speaker: Niles
text: No, no!  This would be good for us, play it.

speaker: Harvest
text: [_hands the tape to Daphne_] It was an 18-hour labor. _She sits cross-legged in front of the TV as Daphne puts it into the VCR. The tape starts, and there is a sound of a bongo drum being played softly. Daphne turns to step back to the couch._

speaker: Harvest
text: This should be about two hours into it.

speaker: Niles
text: I'm so excited.  Daphne, I can't wait until this is us. _A scream of pure, hellish agony rips from the TV.  Daphne jerks around to stare, Niles and Martin rear back in horror._

speaker: Harvest
text: [_enraptured_] Oh, look at Cindy glow!

speaker: Cindy
text: [_on TV_] Mother of God, just kill me! [_scream_]

speaker: Daphne
text: [_nervously_] She seems like she's in a little pain. [_scream_]

speaker: Harvest
text: Oh, pain is just fear leaving the body.

speaker: Martin
text: [_staring at the TV_] That's a boatload of fear. [_scream_]

speaker: Cindy
text: STOP THAT DAMN DRUM BEFORE I PUT YOUR HEAD THROUGH IT! [_scream_]

speaker: Harvest
text: She laughed at that afterwards. [_scream_]

speaker: Daphne
text: I've seen enough.

speaker: Harvest
text: Wait, wait!  You'll see how Cindy pushes through the pain.

speaker: Daphne
text: I'm not pushing through anything.  I'm having my baby the way God intended -- in a hospital, numb from the waist down. _As she escorts Harvest to the door, Martin nods in approval and reaches for his goldfish crackers._

speaker: Daphne
text: Now, take your incense and your woo-woo stick and get out. _She shuts the door on Harvest, then turns.  Niles is rubbing his nipples again._

speaker: Daphne
text: And you, stop acting pregnant -- you're a man, for God's sakes. _Niles drops his hands.  FADE TO:  Scene Seven -- Claret Frasier is back at the same table, twiddling his thumbs and waiting for his latest date.  Charlotte enters the restaurant and sees him. _

speaker: Frasier
text: Charlotte, where's my date?

speaker: Charlotte
text: I am so sorry.  She just called, she had to cancel.

speaker: Frasier
text: That does it.

speaker: Charlotte
text: No, we'll find another evening.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, Charlotte, we will not.  You have sent me on enough miserable dates, thank you.  Before you fix me up with a doll-collecting war criminal, or a hashish-smoking burger flipper, I want out!  And I want my money back.

speaker: Charlotte
text: Frasier, this... _She pulls out the chair and sits down.  He reluctantly sits opposite her._

speaker: Charlotte
text: This is a process.  I have only sent you out on five dates. Do you cure your patients in five sessions?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, no, but...

speaker: Charlotte
text: This client roster is filled with fascinating women.  I just signed a new one this morning -- botany professor, avid bicycle rider, _very_ striking.  But you know what?  If you're going to be so impatient, then we should just end this now, I'll write you a check. [_lifts her purse_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, wait...

speaker: Charlotte
text: No, no, no, no, I'm sure you'll do much better on your own. With $10,000 you can download a lot of love.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, let's not be too hasty.  That striking, biking botanist sounded like me.

speaker: Charlotte
text: I don't know.

speaker: Frasier
text: Please?

speaker: Charlotte
text: Don't beg, it's a turn-off.

speaker: Charlotte
text: All right.  Why don't I get us some drinks and then we can talk about our next move?

speaker: Frasier
text: Great. _She goes to the bar.  Overcome with curiosity, Frasier sneaks the binder from her purse.  He flips through the first few pages, seeing portraits of his five previous dates -- and the rest of the pages are blank.  He looks up, enraged.  At the bar, Charlotte is desperately talking him up to a group of four women. _

speaker: Charlotte
text: He's a big radio star -- smart, really sweet.  So think about it.  Here's my card.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_comes up behind her_] You lied to me.  You have five clients. There is no roster of eligible women!

speaker: Charlotte
text: [_snatches the binder back_] You looked at my client log?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, I've seen your log, and I've dated every toad on it!

speaker: Woman
text: Is this the guy?

speaker: Charlotte
text: No, no, no, different guy.  Call me.

speaker: Frasier
text: I think the police might be interested in this little scam of yours.

speaker: Charlotte
text: It is not a scam!  I... I just didn't have time to put the other pictures in, and I will not work one second with someone who threatens me.  I'll mail you a check.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'll save you the price of a stamp.  I'll see you at your office tomorrow.

speaker: Charlotte
text: Fine.  I'd say come alone, but that's a given. _She walks toward the exit.  Suddenly her heel breaks off, she slips and lands hard on her knee, collapsing to the floor with a cry of pain. Frasier, the maitre 'd, and several diners gather around in concern._

speaker: Charlotte
text: [_breaking down_] Oh God!  What a crappy, crappy day!

speaker: Frasier
text: Charlotte, are you okay?

speaker: Charlotte
text: I can't give you a check.  I've already... I've already spent the money on rent, and food, and... and these shoes. [_takes one off and hammers it on the floor_] These stupid, stupid shoes!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_helps her up_] Come on now, it's okay.

speaker: Charlotte
text: No, it's not!  Nothing's okay.  I lied to you.  I just started this business.  But I'm really good at what I do! I used to run the biggest matchmaking business in Chicago -- before I lost it to my rotten ex-husband in the divorce.

speaker: Frasier
text: Divorce?  But you're wearing a wedding ring.

speaker: Charlotte
text: [_holds up her hand_] It's camouflage.  It inspires confidence. I mean, nobody wants a matchmaker whose life's a mess - like me!

speaker: Charlotte
text: I'm divorced, my business is a joke, and I'm up to my ass in debt, and I had to move in with my mother.  I am thirty-five years old, and I am living with my mother!  How pathetic is that?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_carefully_] Well, I... I've seen worse.  You mentioned something earlier about having a drink.

speaker: Charlotte
text: Oh, believe me, I will.  If my mother hasn't finished the bottle.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, I meant here. [_signals the waiter_]

speaker: Charlotte
text: No, I really can't.  I've got to get home.  I have paperwork, I have calls to make...

speaker: Frasier
text: It's my treat.

speaker: Charlotte
text: [_"life preserver!"_] Double Scotch. _DISSOLVE TO:  Scene Eight -- Claret -- Later that Night Frasier and Charlotte have moved on from drinks and are still talking as they finish the remains of a meal.  Charlotte, much more relaxed, is toying with what's left on her plate, while Frasier has a glass of brandy. _

speaker: Charlotte
text: So then I spent five soul-sucking years in advertising dreaming up slogans for Crunchios.

speaker: Frasier
text: "Crunchios are a munchy with your lunchy or your brunchy." That was you?

speaker: Charlotte
text: Yeah.  I felt better about myself when I was pushing cigarettes. [_Frasier laughs_] Then one day, I fixed up my boss with my friend, and they ended up getting married.

speaker: Frasier
text: And thus a career was born.

speaker: Charlotte
text: What better way to make a living than by helping people be happy? _Frasier smiles -- this speaks to him. _

speaker: Frasier
text: So does your old boss toast you every year when he celebrates his anniversary?

speaker: Charlotte
text: Actually, he's a she now, and my friend's kind of bitter. But I got the hang of it after that.  Well, until I lost the business and came here and moved in with my crazy-ass mother.

speaker: Frasier
text: For what it's worth, it will get easier living with her.

speaker: Charlotte
text: [_laughs_] Is that your professional opinion?

speaker: Frasier
text: Actually, it's a personal one.  My dad lives with me.

speaker: Charlotte
text: No.

speaker: Frasier
text: Mm, 11 years.

speaker: Charlotte
text: Yikes.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yeah, yeah.  It does take a while to adjust to each other before you're perfectly in sync.

speaker: Charlotte
text: How long did that take?

speaker: Frasier
text: I'll let you know.

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah, truth be told, I'm going to miss him when he moves out.

speaker: Charlotte
text: I was missing my mother when I was in Chicago.  Now I just wish she was missing.

speaker: Charlotte
text: I didn't realize it was so late. [_stands_] Frank's waiting for me at home.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_stands_] Frank?

speaker: Charlotte
text: My boyfriend.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh... serious?

speaker: Charlotte
text: Yes, but he has a fun-loving side, too.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, I meant the relationship.  Do you lie awake nights thinking about him?

speaker: Charlotte
text: ...A little.  It's still new, but I have my fingers crossed.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, good luck with it.

speaker: Charlotte
text: Thank you. [_leans in_] And if you'll let me, I'm going to find someone fantastic for you too, Frasier, because you deserve it.

speaker: Frasier
text: And because you have my $10,000.

speaker: Charlotte
text: Are you going to mention that every time you see me?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_backing off_] Well, all right... _They smile at each other.  He sits back down.  As she is leaving, she glances back.  Frasier smiles to himself and opens the bill.  FADE TO:  Scene Nine -- Frasier's Bedroom The lights are off, and the clock over the bed reads "4:30 AM." Frasier is lying awake in bed, staring at the ceiling, his head cradled in his hands. _

speaker: Frasier
text: Damn. _But he still can't keep from smiling, even as he gives a wistful sigh.  END OF ACT TWO_
